name: Build the App
description: Time to put everything together! In this capstone project, you'll build a working Learning Journal API that combines Python, FastAPI, databases, and LLM integration. This project synthesizes all Phase 2 skills into a complete application.
short_description: Build a Learning Journal API with FastAPI, PostgreSQL, and AI-powered entry analysis using LLMs.

learning_steps.text: Go to the Journal Starter Repository
learning_steps.title: Journal Starter Repository
learning_steps.description: The repository README has everything you need: Dev Container setup, development tasks using feature branches, LLM provider configuration, and troubleshooting tips. Fork the repo and follow the instructions there to build your Journal API.

• Read the entire README before starting—it's comprehensive
• Use feature branches and PRs for each task (great practice for real projects)
• Start with the API endpoints before tackling LLM integration
• Test frequently using the /docs endpoint
• Store API keys in your .env file, never in code
• Don't rush—understanding beats completion speed

When you've completed the capstone, push your work to GitHub! This becomes part of your portfolio. Consider sharing it on LinkedIn or the Learn to Cloud community Discord to get feedback and celebrate your progress.

questions.prompt: Walk me through the architecture of your Journal API and how the different components integrate.
scenario_seeds: You're presenting your capstone project to a senior engineer. Explain how requests flow from the API endpoint through to the database and LLM.
A teammate wants to understand your codebase before contributing. Walk them through the project structure and how components connect.
You're writing documentation for your Journal API. Describe the architecture so future maintainers understand the system.
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain FastAPI handles HTTP requests AND PostgreSQL stores journal entries AND LLM provides analysis AND describe how these components integrate in the request flow.

expected: API to database to LLM flow

questions.prompt: How did you implement LLM analysis for journal entries, and what prompt engineering techniques did you apply?
scenario_seeds: Your LLM analysis returns inconsistent JSON formats causing parsing errors. Explain how you solved this with prompt engineering.
A colleague wants to add new analysis features like mood tracking. Explain how your prompt structure makes this extensible.
You're debugging why sentiment analysis is inaccurate for short entries. Walk through your prompt design and potential improvements.
questions.grading_rubric: Must explain the prompt structure including system message AND how structured output ensures valid JSON AND describe what analysis is performed (sentiment, topics, summary).

test_knowledge_prompts: Can you review my FastAPI code and check if I'm following best practices?
Can you help me debug why my LLM analysis isn't returning structured JSON?
Can you explain how to set up environment variables for my API keys?
Can you quiz me on REST API design principles?
Can you help me write better error handling for my endpoints?
Can you explain the difference between sync and async database calls in FastAPI?
Can you review my prompt engineering for the journal analysis feature?

learning_objectives.text: How to fork and set up a starter repository
How to use Dev Containers for development
How to implement CRUD endpoints in FastAPI
How to connect to a database and create schemas
How to integrate LLM APIs for intelligent features
How to add proper error handling
How to test API endpoints using Swagger UI
How to write effective README documentation
How to push and share your project on GitHub
